result.header: Saint Paul-Nagasaki Sister City Committee celebration dinner
result.summary: A celebration dinner will recognize the students who have completed the first year of the exchange program between Metropolitan State University and Nagasaki University. The Saint Paul-Nagasaki Sister City Committee (SPNSCC) will host the annual dinner.

result.header: Lunch and learn with American Sign Language Student Organization
result.summary: Metropolitan State University's ASL Student Organization is hosting lunch and learn sessions at the university's Student Center.

This time of year, it can be hard to keep the stress bubble from popping. To help students unwind, the Library and Learning Center, in conjuction with Healthcare and Wellness Services and Counseling Services, is offering stress management events during the first week of December.

Complete your application and enrollment by attending Metropolitan State University's Metro Express Enrollment event. Scholarships of $1,000 will be awarded on the spot for those who qualify and meet admission requirements.

Metropolitan State University's Nursing Student Organization (NSO) is excited to announce the Entry Level Master of Science in Nursing (ELMSN) pinning ceremony on December 8. The pinning ceremony will be held in Founder's Hall, followed by a reception in the New Main, Great Hall.
Approximately 1,354 students are receiving bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees this semester with 775 students expected to participate in the fall commencement ceremony.

Union Depot's 5th Annual Holiday Bake Sale will host the top Twin Cities bakeries for a day of cookie, candy and holiday shopping on December 9 in the Waiting Room at Union Depot. Proceeds from ticket sales benefit Neighborhood House.

Internship Information Sessions will include information about policies and procedures, strategies for locating internship sites and instructions on completing internship forms. University students and alumni are welcome to attend.

The Neighborhood House will be hosting seven free produce distribution events at Metropolitan State University this harvest season. Between November and May, Neighborhood House will be sharing fresh fruits, vegetables and other vital food with anyone in the Saint Paul community needing food support.

Dayton's Bluff Library invites the community to attend a Star Party. The party will allow attendees to explore the moon, constellations, planets, galaxies and more. The event will feature Mike Lynch, meteorologist at WCCO Radio.
